DOC.brief_summary: To compare bromfenac 0.09 % , diclofenac sodium 0.1 % , ketorolac tromethamine 0.5 % ophthalmic solution treatment acute pseudophakic CME cataract surgery .
DOC.brief_title: Treatment Acute Pseudophakic Cystoid Macular Edema : Bromfenac 0.09 % Versus Diclofenac Sodium 0.1 % Versus Ketorolac Tromethamine 0.5 %
DOC.criteria: Patients must diagnose acute pseudophakic CME within 12 month cataract surgery Males females 18 year older Able provide write informed consent Complicated cataract surgery , particularly posterior capsule rupture vitreous loss PreExisting macular pathology , include macular edema , macular scar , macular hole , macular pucker History Uveitis Ipsilateral intraocular surgery prior cataract surgery CME great one year duration
